convoturns.lexia: Come on, feel the fear...
Too fat, too fat!
Stop it!
Can't do it, Frankie! Can't look.
I get you. I know it's hard. Just breathe in and out.
Now open your eyes and look at your face.
Shut tight.
I can't.
Okay. What's the easiest part of your body to look at?
Flab everywhere!
None of it. I don't like any of it!
You don't have to like it, Hayley.
It's about getting used to looking at your body and accepting your body...
Fat chance.
Shut up!
despite all the horrible thoughts and judgements you have about it.
But I don't want the horrible thoughts!
I know, Hayley. But the thing is, we can't get rid of the awful thoughts and feelings.
Why not?!
If we try to push them away or push them down...
they just get worse.
It's like trying to keep a beach ball under water. Takes a lot of effort.
Imagine it. You're pushing a beach ball under water, trying to keep it down. What happens if you loosen your grip?
It shoots back up again.
And what then?
Push it down again.
You gonna keep on doing that? All day long? That's a lot of struggling.
What if you just let it go?
It pops up again!
Yeah, so let it. What happens then?
To the beach ball? It bobs around on the water.
And maybe drifts away...
Might do, might not. But at least you're not trying to keep it under water and you can focus on something else.
Something that's important to you.
Like trying to love my body?
Ah, but then you're back to pushing the beach ball under water.
I don't get you.
It's not about turning your body hate thoughts into body love thoughts. That doesn't work.
Why not?
When you force yourself to think positive thoughts, what happens is...
they remind you of those negative thoughts you've been trying to get rid of!
Oh! So saying, I love my body reminds me that I hate my body?
Yes! What's the first thing that pops into your head when I say... positive?
Negative.
See? Doesn't matter how hard you try to think positive...
That's why I don't want to go bopo dancing!
I get that. But wouldn't it be fun too? All dancing together.
Yes but all those thoughts! Positive turning to negative! No way!
But what if you could go dancing and enjoy having fun with me even though the thoughts are still there?
Impossible!
What if you don't have to focus on them?
That annoying beach ball could still be there, bobbing around, but so what? Let it.
What if you can focus on the dancing...
moving your body, enjoying the music, feeling the rhythm...
sensing it all in the moment?
Sounds good... But...
Jiggling fat!
I don't think I'm ready. I can't even look in the mirror, never mind dancing!
Sorry. That's my fault, Hayley.
I tried to push you in at the deep end with the mirror. So stupid of me!
Hey, it's okay.
I really messed up. I'm sorry. Such an idiot!
Don't be so hard on yourself, Frankie. It's okay.
You tried to help. That means a lot to me.
It does?
Yes. But, I really don't think I can face bopo dancing tonight. Sorry.
Okay, Hayley.
Another time maybe.
